articles.author: Emiko Muraki and Penny Pexman, University of Calgary
articles.title: How children grasp language
articles.description: Kids' physical experiences with their environment help them learn new words. Words that refer to objects that children can interact with easily are also words they learn at an earlier age. A word such as spoon is usually learned earlier than sky.
